divs: Sighting DetailsI was driving alone from Ocean City, NJ heading west on the Atlantic City Expressway towards Philadelphia and was about 5 miles west of the Egg Harbor Toll Plaza. It was about 10:40 on the morning of Saturday, September 5 and it was a beautiful sunny day with a mostly cloudless clear blue sky. At about a 45 degree angle in the sky directly in front of me (looking west) I observed a small, flat-white object, shaped like a little tophat, appear out of nowhere in the sky. It descended in an erractic flight pattern for a couple of seconds then disappeared. A couple seconds later, it reappeared as before, descended in the sky in the same erractic manner for a couple seconds, then disappeared for good. I watched the local news that evening to see if there was any coverage of strange UFO-like sightings, but there was none. I tried to contact the astronomer at the Franklin Institute to discuss with him, but couldn't find a listing of his email address. I told my wife of this event and she later happened upon your website from something she had seen in the paper about an upcoming convention. What did I think the object was when I first noticed it? I don't know, but I sure couldn't identify it. I had seen something like this about 40 years ago when I was about 13 or 14. Ron Moser
Summary: I saw a small white object against a clear blue sky. It was shaped like a tophat and flew erratically for a moment, disappeared, then reappeared before disappearing again.
trends: There have been 11 other sightings in Philadelphia
There were no other sightings in Philadelphia on or around September 5th 2009
